title: U.S. Hits Brazil With 50% Tariffs and Sanctions in Sharp Escalation
summary: The White House hit Brazil on Wednesday with a 50 percent tariff and sanctions on a justice overseeing investigations into former President Jair Bolsonaro.

title: Trump Threatens India With Steep Tariffs, Including Penalty Over Russian Oil
summary: The president said Wednesday that imports from India would be subject to a 25 percent tariff as of Friday, as trade talks between the countries hit a stumbling block.

title: Trump Targets Copper With Tariffs, Though Not as Aggressively as Expected
summary: The president stopped short of putting a 50 percent tariff on refined copper, as he had threatened earlier this year. The market reaction was swift anyway and prices tumbled.

title: What Kamala Harris’s Decision for Governor Means for 2028
summary: A Harris ally says “all options are on the table” but cautions against reading too much into the former vice president’s choice to skip the California governor race.

title: Texas Republicans Unveil Gerrymandered House Map, Trying to Please Trump
summary: The proposed map would give Republicans a chance to gain five U.S. House seats, including in Houston, Dallas and along the U.S.-Mexican border.

title: Brown University Makes a Deal With the White House to Restore Funding
summary: The deal, which will require Brown to spend $50 million, comes after two other Ivy League schools negotiated with the Trump administration to restore millions in research dollars.

title: ‘Loyalty Enforcer’ Laura Loomer Targets Additional Officials
summary: The far-right activist is continuing to use her close association with President Trump to go after those she deems insufficiently loyal.

title: Bill Barring Stock Trading for Congress Advances With Trump Carve-Out
summary: The bill passed the committee with the support of every Democrat and only one Republican, its sponsor, who modified it to shield President Trump from a divestment requirement.

title: Trump Administration Authorizes Deployment of National Guard at ICE Facilities
summary: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement memo said that National Guard troops would assist in the deportation process for migrants in their custody.

title: Jason Momoa Prefers to Be Called a ‘Sensitive Alpha Male’
summary: For “Chief of War,” the actor went from playing fictional superheroes to a real one in this epic passion project set in Hawaii.

title: Gaza Hunger Presents Trump With Moral Test Familiar to Past Presidents
summary: The crisis has echoes of past humanitarian crises that left presidents wringing their hands over how to respond.

title: Canada to Recognize Palestinian State at the U.N. General Assembly
summary: Canada joins France and Britain in taking similar steps, after months of increasing criticism of Israel by Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: Fed Keeps Rates Steady Despite Internal Divisions and Political Pressure
summary: The central bank kept interest rates steady for a fifth straight meeting, despite badgering from President Trump. It has “made no decisions” on cutting rates at its next meeting, the Fed chair said.

title: Treasury Secretary Says Trump Accounts Could Pave Way to Privatizing Social Security
summary: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s comments about the safety net program ventured onto the so-called third rail of American politics.

title: Park Avenue Killer Bought Rifle for $1,400 From His Casino Boss
summary: The man who gunned down four people at a Park Avenue office building left anti-psychotic medication in his Las Vegas apartment, and a note.

title: N.T.S.B. Details Evidence in Fatal Crash at Reagan National Airport
summary: Flight instruments probably led the Black Hawk crew to believe the helicopter was lower than it actually was before the collision with a commercial airplane on Jan. 29.

title: Canada’s Measles Cases Surpass U.S., Alberta Officials Push for State of Emergency
summary: Some doctors in Alberta have criticized officials for not declaring a health emergency in the western province where measles infections are surging.

title: Brennan and Clapper: The Trump Administration Is Rewriting History of Russia and 2016
summary: We want to set the record straight and also sound a warning.

title: This Is the Moment Democrats Have Been Talking About for Years
summary: The party establishment is missing its chance to prove there is more to it than just outrage and opposition.

title: Trump Escalated His Feud With Brazil
summary: Also, Kamala Harris will not run for California governor. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: N.Y.C. Subway and Bus Fares Are Likely to Increase to $3 in January 2026
summary: The proposed 10-cent increase, the first since 2023, has been long in the works and would come after the mothballing of the MetroCard.

title: Why Did Such a Powerful Earthquake Generate Such a Weak Tsunami?
summary: The quake in Russia on Wednesday was among the strongest ever recorded — but in many places, the resulting wave was small.

title: Laura Dahlmeier, Gold Medal-Winning German Biathlete, Dies in Rockfall
summary: Ms. Dahlmeier, 31, an experienced mountaineer, was climbing in Pakistan when she was hit by falling rocks, officials said.

title: Virginia City Councilman, Lee Vogler, Is Set on Fire in Attack, Police Say
summary: A man burst into an office in Danville, Va., where the councilman, J. Lee Vogler, was working, doused him with a flammable liquid and set him on fire, the authorities said.
